title: How Sight—Not Taste, Smell, or Touch—Became the Sense of the Supermarket -
excerpt: When it comes to buying food, sight has usurped all other senses. What are the consequences of relegating smell, taste, and touch to the sidelines?

title: The unique culture of Japanese convenience stores - BBC Travel
excerpt: The true star of the Akutagawa Prize-winning novel Convenience Store Woman is the convenience store itself. But what is it that makes these shops so magical?

title: The Worst Rebrand in the History of Orange Juice
excerpt: They paid $35 million to then lose $20m in sales
